Package com.ibm.streams.management.job

Interface PeConnectionMXBean

public interface PeConnectionMXBean
PeConnectionMXBean provides attributes, operations, and notifications for managing a processing element (PE) connection of a Streams job.

Note: The job must be registered before accessing any of these attributes or operations. See InstanceMXBean.registerJob(BigInteger) for more information.

ObjectNameBuilder.peConnection(String, String, String) can be used to build the ObjectName for a PeConnectionMXBean.

Notifications:
A PeConnectionMXBean supports sending the following notifications:

javax.management.AttributeChangeNotification.ATTRIBUTE_CHANGE
Only a subset of the attributes support attribute change notification. A note is included in the attribute description for each attribute that supports attribute change notification

The JobMXBean snapshot and PeMXBean snapshot operations provide an option to include attributes of descendant objects in the generated snapshot. If the value of the maximumDepth parameter identifies PE connection attributes should be included in the snapshot, the JSON format of the PE connection information returned is described in the product documentation. See topic: REST management API reference > Get PE connection. The following differences exist for the JMX output:

  • The REST specific properties: resourceType, restid, and self are not included.
  • The metrics, property is not included.
  • The values of the job, pe, and outputPort properties of the embedded source object are the unique identifiers for each.
  • The values of the job, pe, and inputPort properties of the embedded target object are the unique identifiers for each.

    PeConnectionMXBean.Status
    Enumeration for the current status of the PE connection.

    Enumeration for the transport mechanisms used by the connection to communicate across processing elements (PEs).

    • IBM_Teracloud_ApS_COPYRIGHT

      static final String IBM_Teracloud_ApS_COPYRIGHT
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • TYPE

      static final String TYPE
      TYPE is used to identify this bean as a PE connection bean when building the bean's ObjectName. The value is "domain.instance.pe.connection"
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

  • Method Details

    • getId

      String getId()
      Returns the unique identifier for the connection within the instance.
      Returns:
      the instance identifier.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the operation is unable to complete successfully.
      SecurityException - if the current user does not have the required permissions to perform the operation. Information about Streams permissions can be found in the product documentation. See topic: Security objects for Teracloud Streams domains and instances.

    • isRequired

      boolean isRequired()
      Indicates whether the connection is required to be connected before messages are processed for the PE.

      Note: This attribute is not included in the snapshot on a JobMXBean.snapshot(int, boolean) or a JobMXBean.snapshot(int, boolean) call if includeStaticAttributes is false.

      Returns:
      the required indicator for the connection.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the operation is unable to complete successfully.
      SecurityException - if the current user does not have the required permissions to perform the operation. Information about Streams permissions can be found in the product documentation. See topic: Security objects for Teracloud Streams domains and instances.

      Returns:
      the source job identifier.

    • retrieveMetrics

      Set<Metric> retrieveMetrics()
      Retrieves the metric information and values for the PE connection. A metric is a measurement of an element associated with the PE connection.
      Returns:
      the set of metrics for the PE connection.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the operation is unable to complete successfully.
      SecurityException - if the current user does not have the required permissions to perform the operation. Information about Streams permissions can be found in the product documentation. See topic: Security objects for Teracloud Streams domains and instances.
      See Also:
      • Metric
      • InstanceMXBean.retrieveJobSystemMetricMetadata()
